abstracts.cdata!:
Consistent with IDA's long term
            strategy of reinforcing public sector management under its
            first three technical assistance credits, the Economic
            Management and Public Enterprise Credit Project's main
            objective is to help Government implement its structural
            adjustment program by making the management of the public
            sector more efficient.  To this end, the project hopes to:
            (a) improve the management of the Public Enterprise Sector;
            (b) improve sectoral and project work, statistical work and
            the planning-programming and budgeting functions in the
            Ministry of Planning and technical ministries; and (c)
            improve the Public Expenditure Program process in the
            Finance Ministry.  As a result, the project consists of
            three components corresponding to each of the above
            objectives with the public enterprise component as the main
            focus of the project.  It involves financing to (i) launch
            the operations of the National Service in Charge of Public
            Enterprises (PEs); (ii) develop Government's planning
            and project appraisal capabilities, provide related
            training, and carry out the identification, preparation and
            execution of sectoral and preinvestment studies; and (c)
            design a unified budget system in the Ministry of Finance
            and provide related training.
